title: Bug 47910 - ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the outjar option with ajc, the resulting file should be a valid jar file. However, currently, if a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file is present inside the project, it is not included in the generated jar file.
OB: When I call ajc with the sourceroots option followed by my input directory and then use the outjar option followed by a desired output file name with .jar extension, it creates an output file. However, the resulting file is not a valid jar file because it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: When I call ajc with the sourceroots option followed by my input directory and then use the outjar option followed by a desired output file name with .jar extension, it should create a valid jar file. The resulting jar file should include the content of the input directory and a MANIFEST.MF file, if present inside the project.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Invoke ajc with the sourceroots option followed by the directory containing the source files. 
2. Use the outjar option followed by a desired output file name with .jar extension. 
3. Check the generated jar file for the presence of the input directory content and a MANIFEST.MF file, if present in the project.
